pr_title: Renames internal ExtraHandler back to ExtraFactory and clarifies

timeline.message:
Renames internal ExtraHandler back to ExtraFactory and clarifies

When integrating secondary sampling, I found the new name (I caused)
more distracting then helpful. The defensive api which led to renaming
was a cure worse than the disease of a preventable programming error.

Instead, this improves Javadoc, notably mentioning how to use the
factory properly (and not crashing on mistake).

timeline.bodyText: note: this is public just because the type itself lives in a different package (brave.internal.baggage) than the call site (brave.baggage). In most cases, they will be in the same package, so implementations can leave it protected.
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

Method overview

+ * {@link #decorate(TraceContext)} ensures that the resulting {@link TraceContext} has an instance + * of "extra" ({@link #}), that it is associated only with the context's span ID, and that fields + * inside "extra" considers upstream values, such as from a parent span. + * + *

+ * The only valid way to integrate this is via a custom {@link Propagation.Factory}. Its {@link + * Propagation.Factory#decorate(TraceContext)} method MUST dispatch to {@link + * #decorate(TraceContext)}. + * + *

Notes

+ *

The reason {@link #create()} is decoupled from {@link #decorate(TraceContext)} is because + * extra data can exist in a request even if a trace context does not.
